description: Modifies the KMS key for an existing database. While updating the database, you must specify the database name and the identifier of the new KMS key to be used ( KmsKeyId). If there are any concurrent UpdateDatabase requests, first writer wins. See code sample for details.

parameters.name: KmsKeyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the new KMS key ( KmsKeyId) to be used to encrypt the data stored in the database. If the KmsKeyId currently registered with the database is the same as the KmsKeyId in the request, there will not be any update. You can specify the KmsKeyId using any of the following: Key ID: 1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab Key ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab Alias name: alias/ExampleAlias Alias ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name that uniquely identifies this database.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of the Timestream database.

nested_items.name: TableCount
nested_items.description: The total number of tables found within a Timestream database.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the KMS key used to encrypt the data stored in the database.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time when the database was created, calculated from the Unix epoch time.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The last time that this database was updated.
